p: It was reported that α-asarone alleviates epilepsy by modulating GABA A receptors and inhibiting neuronal Na + channels [ 4, 54]. While many other compounds like borneol were reported to act as positive allosteric GABA A receptor agonists to exert anxiolytic-like effects [ 14, 16, 102], recent studies demonstrated that α-asarone acted as both a positive allesteric GABA A receptor agonist as well as a neuronal Na + channel blocker [ 4, 5].
